page.title: 08CHILWELL. Local History.
page.content:
Mr Hinton came to talk to us about Chilwell. Mr Hinton said he came to Meadow Lane School when he was four. He is 80 years old. He said Chilwell was a very little village and there were no buses or cars and not many houses in the village, when he was young. The school had the school bells on the school wall and when the bell rang they had to line up in the playground. When he was young he said only 900 people lived there and there were only a few houses. They had horses and carts on the road and only a few of them so games like marbles could be played.
Samantha Gibbs Meadow Lane School.
